intro: Clutia scandens, commonly known as the climbing clutia, is a tropical flowering plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its trailing or climbing growth habit and produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape and often have a velvety texture. Clutia scandens is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
